Kristen Bancroft and Bruce Weinstein are to be married today at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden. The Rev. Daniel E. Walker, a Pentecostal minister, is to officiate.

The bride, 39, is keeping her name. She is a senior compliance manager in investment banking at Bank of America, in New York. She graduated from Princeton and received a law degree from New York University.

She is the daughter of Judy Bancroft of Langhorne, Pa., and the late William D. Bancroft. Her father was a civil engineer in the New Jersey Transportation Department. Her mother retired as a teacher at Parkway School in Ewing, N.J.
The bridegroom, 46, is the author of ''Life Principles: Feeling Good by Doing Good'' (Emmis Books, 2005). He also writes a weekly online column called Ask the Ethics Guy on BusinessWeek.com.

He graduated from Swarthmore and received a master's and a Ph.D. in philosophy from Georgetown. He is the son of Sheila V. Weinstein of New York and Dr. George W. Weinstein of Encinitas, Calif. His father is the former president of the American Academy of Ophthalmology in San Francisco.
